direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check for the presence of a specific attribute (class vs. any attribute) in the elements.
The addClass method complements hasClass by adding a class to elements, which can be tested with hasClass.
The removeClass method complements hasClass by removing a class from elements, which can be tested with hasClass.
The toggleClass method complements hasClass by toggling a class on elements, which can be tested with hasClass.
Both methods check for the presence of a specific content (class vs. text) in the elements.
Both methods access and manipulate attributes of elements, though attr retrieves the value.
Both methods access and manipulate attributes of elements, though eachAttr retrieves multiple values.
Both methods access and manipulate attributes of elements, though removeAttr removes the attribute.
Both methods evaluate elements based on a condition (class presence vs. selector match).
The select method depends on the structure and attributes of elements, which can be influenced by class presence.
